arts.ttl: Merson: Chelsea are a cup team - and Wolves clash is massive
arts.sum: Paul Merson says Chelsea's lack of experience is a massive factor in their inconsistent Premier League form, but he believes they still have the talent to continue to do well in cup competitions.

arts.ttl: Is Wolves v Chelsea on TV? Channel, start time and how to watch Carabao Cup online tonight
arts.sum: All you need to know as Chelsea visit Molineux in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup

arts.ttl: Wolves vs. Chelsea: Preview, Predictions and Lineups
arts.sum: The result brought Chelsea ’s four-match winning streak to a close and saw them sink to ninth in the Premier League table, but they can return to winning ways in the cup when they visit struggling Wolves in the first of two meetings between the teams before the November international break. The Carabao Cup has brought the only wins of Wolves ’ season to date as pressure mounts on Vítor Pereira, who angrily confronted fans at Molineux over the weekend.

arts.ttl: Wolves vs. Chelsea injury, suspension list, predicted XIs
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up all of the latest injury and suspension news ahead of Wednesday's EFL Cup clash between Wolverhampton Wanderers and Chelsea.

arts.ttl: Chelsea Predicted Lineup vs. Wolves: Delap Returns in Much-Changed XI
arts.sum: Chelsea’s shock 2–1 defeat at home to Sunderland at the weekend will have unnerved the Blues heading into the midweek match-up, but Enzo Maresca will feel confident of a swift return to winning ways given the dire form of Wolves. The 23-year-old has featured in just three matches this term, although he should start in every Carabao Cup clash.

arts.ttl: Wolves v Chelsea predictions: Blues too strong for struggling hosts
arts.sum: Elliott Bretland is tipping Chelsea to add to Wolves' struggles this season by winning an entertaining League Cup fourth round tie at Molineux.

arts.ttl: Chelsea star ‘available’ to face Wolves following injury
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca confirmed that Liam Delap will be ready to play against Wolves after making a recovery from injury. The clubs face off for a place in the quarter-finals of the League Cup at Molineux on Wednesday evening, with kickoff set for 7.45pm BST. Delap has been sidelined with a hamstring injury since […] The post Chelsea star ‘available’ to face Wolves following injury first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Maresca suggests Chelsea trio could miss Wolves EFL Cup tie, provides latest Delap update
arts.sum: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca suggests that three of his key players could be rested for Wednesday's EFL Cup tie at Wolverhampton Wanderers, as well as providing an update on Liam Delap.
